name: Heart Disease
description:
Diseases of the Heart

Deaths : 4,850,000

ICD-10 Codes : I00–I09,I11,I13,I20–I51 a subsection of Major Cardiovacular Diseases

The largest cause of cardiovascular disease is atherosclerosis, which is fatty plaque buildup in arteries. Atherosclerosis can be prevented by healthy lifestyle choices, including good diet, exercise, healthy weight, and not smoking.

name: Cancer
description:
Cancer / Malignant Neoplasms

Deaths : 4,610,000

ICD-10 Codes : C00-C97

Top three cancers are

  1. Lung and Bronchial
  2. Colon and rectal
  3. Breast

Tobacco use is the greatest risk factor leading to ~ 20% of global cancer deaths.

name: Medical Error
description:
Medical Error

Deaths : 1,010,000

Medical error has no ICD code and has not been tracked consistently. In the recent years, research has found the number of deaths due to medical error to be much higher than earlier estimated. This number was calculated by Makary et al after conducting extensive literature review.

It includes unintended acts, acts that don't achieve intended outcomes, error of execution of plans, use of the wrong plan to achieve aim, or a deviation from the care process.

name: Chronic Lower Resp Disease
description:
Chronic Lower Respiratory Disease

Deaths : 1,130,000

ICD-10 Codes : J40-J47

This includes Chronic Bronchitis, Emphysema, and Asthma all of which entail airway obstruction and shortness of breath.

name: Stroke
description:
Stroke / Cerebrovascular Disease

Deaths : 1,050,000

ICD-10 Codes : I60–I69

Anyone can have a stroke, but family history, conditions (such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, heart disease, and others), and behaviours (such as tobaccor use, physical inactivity, unhealthy diet, and others) can add to your risk.

name: Accidents
description:
Accidents / Unintentional Injuries

Deaths : 1,000,000

ICD-10 Codes : V01-X59, Y85-Y86

Compromised primarily of falls, motor vehicle traffic accidents and unintentional poisoning deaths.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description:
Alzheimer's Disease

Deaths : 670,000

ICD-10 Code : G30

Ad is the most prevalent form of dementia. AD can be hereditary, but age is the primary risk factor.

Researchers still have not pinpointed what causes the disease.

As our population ages, the number of deaths per year is expected to nearly triple.

name: Diabetes
description:
Diabetes Mellitus

Deaths : 580,000

ICD-10 Code : E10-E14

Because Diabetes is underdiagnosed and may be underreported in death certificates, this number is most likely an underestimate.
